eval_pos_texts: Start with a numbered checklist: 1) confirm scope, 2) collect inputs, 3) draft outline, 4) review.
Organize the report into sections: Background, Method, Findings, Risks, and Next Steps, each with a target word count.
Record each task with an owner, due date, and status so nothing falls through.
Use a table to compare vendors by cost, timeline, support, and risk.
Define the file structure as /project/01_planning, /02_execution, /03_review to keep order.
Log every change request with a timestamp, impact note, and approval decision.
Run the dataset cleaning in this order: remove duplicates, fix types, handle missing values, then validate ranges.
Draft meeting notes with headings for Decisions, Actions, Owners, and Deadlines.
Set explicit acceptance criteria before you begin implementation.
Create a timeline with milestones at week 1, week 2, and final review.
Document assumptions in a short bullet list at the top of the plan.
Check dependencies first, then schedule tasks in the order they unlock.
Use consistent labels for priorities: P0, P1, P2, and define what each means.
Keep a clean index of references with source, date, and link.
Write the tutorial in steps, each with a goal, command, and expected output.
Separate the budget into fixed costs, variable costs, and contingency.
Close the loop by adding a final verification step before delivery.
Make the outline hierarchical: section, subsection, bullet, example.
Specify input formats and output formats before you start.
End with a checklist to confirm all requirements are met.
